summary: Benin, officially the Republic of Benin, is a West African country near the Bight of Benin. With a population of around 13 million, its capital is Porto-Novo, and the largest city is Cotonou. Formerly known as Dahomey, it gained independence from France in 1960. Benin has a tropical climate and an agriculture-based economy, exporting palm oil and cotton. It has a history of slave trade and was once a Marxist-Leninist state. Today, it's a democratic republic with French as the official language. Christianity is the largest religion, followed by Islam and African Traditional Religions. Benin is a member of various international organizations.
title: Benin
